sentence.Network_en: The wheat sprouts grew perceptibly after the rain.
sentence.Network_cn: 下了一场雨,麦苗立刻见长.

sentence.Network_en: The delay did not perceptibly weaken her resolve.
sentence.Network_cn: 这段缓冲时间并未减弱她的决心.

However, if their living conditions become too crowded, their behavior patterns and even their health perceptibly (显然地)change. They cannot sleep and eat.

entry.def: Something that is perceptible can only just be seen or noticed.

example.ex: Pasternak gave him a barely perceptible smile...
example.tran: 帕斯特纳克给了他一个几乎无法察觉的微笑。

example.ex: There was a slight but perceptible air of neglect.
example.tran: 有一种微弱但可察觉的冷落意味。

auth_sentence.content: In extreme cases, when the wait becomes actually long, instead of merely perceptibly long, things fall apart.
auth_sentence.res_content: In extreme cases, when the wait becomes actually long, instead of merely perceptibly long, things fall apart.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In extreme cases, when the wait becomes actually long, instead of merely perceptibly long, things fall apart.
